nodes.bodyText: Can you include the value of type in here - e.g. "Invalid step type: " + type
Done
I think targetEntityType and selectedSource are supposed to stay here - did you mean to remove them? They don't need to exist in matching/merging yet.
Re-added
Per the story, let's stick with match-merge-reader/writer here instead of flow-reader/writer.

nodes.bodyText: Mastering/matching/merging actually use "targetEntity" instead of targetEntityType - that's something we'll be making consistent in 5.4. But while this should be "targetEntity", I think you can safely remove this function altogether, as it's not exported below. Can also remove - getSelectedSourceProperty and getVersionProperty (getVersionProperty really needs to be removed in a separate JIRA ticket altogether, as "version" isn't being used by artifacts yet).

Removing getVersionProperty() causes this error:
RESTAPI-INVALIDCONTENT: (err:FOER0000) Invalid content: invalid mlRunIngest extension: could not parse JavaScript extension mlRunIngest; please see the server error log for detail JS-JAVASCRIPT: getVersionProperty, -- Error running JavaScript request: ReferenceError: getVersionProperty is not defined; mlRunIngest either is not a valid JavaScript module or does not export functions (transform)
That error happens during bootstrap
I don't think any validation is required here - it's best just to return the artifact.
Removed validation
Use match-merge-reader/writer here too.
Done

@ryanjdew There's currently validation in here, and I agree with dropping targetEntityType and selectedSource. But I'm thinking we shouldn't do any validation at all, as I don't think there's a requirement that matching steps currently have a "name". I think we can tackle validation in 5.4.
Removed validation
Same as above - use match-merge-reader/writer and drop validation, along with getEntityNameProperty and getSelectedSourceProperty and getVersionProperty.

nodes.bodyText: I think this should have "@test" on it?
I had intended to remove that. I will replace it with a mastering flow test that uses the small Customer dataset.
There are unfortunately a lot of equality assertions in the DHF codebase that use assertTrue instead of assertEquals - this should be "assertEquals(6, getFinalDocCount(...), "message").
Fixed
installProjectInFolder will do this automatically for you, but the folder has to be named "data" instead of "input"
Renamed to "data"
I believe you can delete this whole try/catch block then, correct?
Yes, I had intended to do that. Just pushed an update with it removed.

I think you should be able to run the mastering test on the same data that you used for the matching and merging test, which I highly recommend because we know there's exactly one match expected. We don't want to repeat the assertions from MasterTest, where we expect a very high count of documents, and when that count isn't met, it's nearly impossible to determine why not.
Will do
This same method exists in MasterTest. I think it can be moved to AbstractHubCoreTest and called in both the tests.
I removed this test adapted from MasterTest and all of its helper methods.

There seems to be a lot of overlap (and duplication) between this test and FlowMigratorTest. I think it would be better to have one test  class in which a project can be migrated, the artifacts verified and then run.

I don't mind a separate test class, as long as we have separate scenarios (in fact, complex scenarios often warrant their own test class with a single test method). I agree that duplication of assertions on ingestions and mapping steps can be removed. But I don't mind a separate class.
I think it would be good to have similar methods for mastering, matching and merging steps and make sure that the files are created and looks as expected.
Can remove this and "requiredProperties" above too; can remove this function from matching and merging too
Done. I had forgotten to remove the function from the exports so I was getting an error in bootstrap.
To Srinath's point above - if we're not introducing any new assertions in the AllSteps class, you could remove the ingestion and mapping steps to simplify the test class.
How would I get the data into the FINAL database (for matching and merging) without ingestion and mapping steps?

In the future, you can just use HubClient to insert documents - see the ReferenceModelProject class for examples of that.
But leaving these steps here for that purpose is fine, no need to redo.
